definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu was still for moderation and concessions to the Wuhan Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 陳獨秀卻依然主張對武漢國民黨的妥協退讓。

sentences.english: So the strong will prevailed, subduing and moulding the gentler.
sentences.chinese: 於是強大的一方獲勝，溫和的一方剋制退讓。

sentences.english: Both men persisted in their have opinions or neither will concede.
sentences.chinese: 雙方都堅持己見並且不肯退讓。

sentences.english: Mr Williams does not shrink from confrontation.
sentences.chinese: Williams先生面對沖突，毫不退讓。

sentences.english: Such as if have no you, your concession, I bathe small talk favorably your lofty and conscientious symbol.
sentences.chinese: 如若沒有你，你退讓，我沐小小讚揚你高風亮節。

sentences.english: Comintern concession in the compromise policy, the cooperation between the Kuomintang and eventually rupture.
sentences.chinese: 在共產國際妥協退讓的政策下，國共合作最終破裂。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to show off/to try to be brave
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
